threats.title: Privilege Abuse by System Admin
threats.description: A system admin may access or alter records without business justification.
threats.mitigation:
Implement audit trails for admin actions
	•	Apply least privilege principle

threats.title: Sessions Never Expire
threats.description: Sessions remain active indefinitely, enabling session hijacking if credentials are stolen.
threats.mitigation:
•	Implement session timeout
	•	Invalidate tokens after logout

threats.title: Cross-Site Scripting in Appointment Manager
threats.description: XSS in Appointment Notes, Malicious JavaScript in appointment descriptions can execute in a doctor’s browser.
threats.mitigation:
•	Sanitize all user inputs
•	Use Content Security Policy (CSP)

threats.title: Unauthorized Access to Medical Records
threats.description: A doctor or user can access patient records they shouldn’t have permission to view
threats.mitigation:
Implement RBAC (Role-Based Access Control)
Regularly audit access controls

threats.title: Unauthorized Access to Medical API
threats.description: Internal APIs lack authentication, allowing attackers to forge requests.
threats.mitigation:
•	Require API key or token authentication
	•	Implement IP whitelisting or mTLS

threats.title: SQL Injection in Login Process
threats.description: An attacker may input SQL code through the login form to bypass authentication
threats.mitigation:
-Use parameterized queries or ORM frameworks
-Sanitize and validate all input fields
-Implement Web Application Firewall (WAF)

threats.title: Unencrypted Data Transmission
threats.description: User credentials are sent without encryption, allowing attackers to intercept them.
threats.mitigation:
Use HTTPS for all communications
Enforce TLS 1.2 or higher

threats.title: Replay of Previous Payment Request
threats.description: An attacker reuses a previous payment request to trigger duplicate payments.
threats.mitigation:
•	Use nonce values and timestamps
	•	Validate all requests for uniqueness

threats.title: Insecure Logging of Sensitive Info
threats.description: Sensitive data such as passwords or tokens are logged insecurely in audit logs.
threats.mitigation:
•Mask or omit sensitive values in logs
Restrict access to log
